results.title: At the threshold of eternity
results.creator_credit: Mikel Way and Colorado State University Production Company
results.brief_description: Dr. James Enderson talks about the ways being used to save endangered or threatened wildlife. The following recovery plans: Habitat Management, Transplanting, and Captive Breeding, are shown in practice with wildlife in several areas of the United States.

results.title: As time goes by
results.creator_credit: Barry Peak, Chris Kiely and Valhalla
results.brief_description: Science fiction comedy about a bizarre encounter between a knockabout surfer and an alien, set in the Australian outback. The alien enlists the surfer’s aid in finding the power capsule for his spaceship which is disguised as a 1940’s diner. However, there are others with sinister plans in search of the diner and the surfer finds he must change the course of time. Cast includes Bruno Lawrence, Nique Needles, Ray Barrett and Max Gillies.

results.title: As our boyhood is...
results.brief_description: A documentary which studies the facilities for education - both good and bad - available to Afro-American children in the southern states of the USA during the mid-1940’s. An interesting documentary for its time for its sympathetic attitude towards the plight of Afro-American children in getting an education. Photography by Roger Barlow and Jospeh Braun.

results.title: Artificial insemination
results.brief_description: Produced for the Royal Agricultural Society of NSW, regarding the attempts to pursue dairy and cattle grazing, and to examine and use artificial insemination as a means of improving stock.

results.title: Area theorems
results.brief_description: Using animated shapes and the manipulation of models (translation and rotation) the facts concerning the area of the triangle, parallelogram and trapezium are demonstrated. An episode from the series “Vision in Mathematics”. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary students.

results.title: Area 1: Barbara arrives in Arealand
results.creator_credit: Agency for Instructional Television and South Carolina TV Network
results.brief_description: In a journey “through her window” Barbara ventures into Arealand for the three programs in the MeasureArea cluster. She explores the concept of area and discovers a variety of ways to determine it with trhe help of many unusual fantasyland characters. In this program Barbara learns that area is two-dimensional and that “covering” is a process to determine area. She encounters square metre, square decimetre and square centimetre. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Arctic people
results.brief_description: This film shows without commentary how hunting is the traditional means of livelihood for the Eskimos in the barren Canadian northland. It also indicates how the less hostile environment of the low Arctic permits the Lapps to engage in husbandry and fishing. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Aquarium wonderland
results.brief_description: In microscopic and unusual close-up scenes and animation, we see how fish breathe, hear, feel, smell and swim. A boy shows how to set up and maintain an aquarium, using the proper amount of water, plants and food for the goldfish and other animal life it contains.

results.title: Aptitudes and occupations: an introduction to vocational guidance
results.brief_description: Discusses six of the fundamental human aptitudes: social, mechanical, clerical, musical, artistic and scholastic; and indicates how a student may, with the help of an educational or vocational counsellor, determine in which of these aptitudes they are most gifted. Indicates the broad fields of employment in which certain combinations of abilities are required. Narrated by Vincent Pelletier.
